pageContext.claim: “You know there was a poll that just came out, it was, I think it was Gallup, and it was a weird kind of a poll because it said 62% of the people that are polled are lying. I said that's a big number, right. I think it was 62%. Couple of weeks ago, it came out and their only line, if it's us, because they don't want to be bothered, in other words, they're not lying about Sleepy Joe, they're lying about us, and I don't know if I'm supposed to love that or hate it.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has trailed Biden in the polls for months. The poll he is referencing was a collaboration between The Hill and Harris Research. It found 66 percent of people said it is likely “that a significant number of people lie when taking political surveys.” Critically, the poll is asking what people think others, which is different than asking if those people are not truthful to pollsters.
